A new incident is assigned to service desk or a support group based on many factors, for example:

  • Contact type: how the incident is created, for example, self-service, call, email.
  • Source: event monitoring, external integrations, and so on.
  • Incident details: category, subcategory, configuration item, location of the caller, and so on.

You can create assignment rules to route incidents to specific teams based on the factors listed above. Assignment rules help reduce the resolution time by automatically assigning an incident to the correct resolution team.

false incident 3 4 false true After an incident is logged, assign it to an appropriate group automatically to ensure that it is handled promptly. An incident can be assigned to a support group based on the configuration item (CI), categorization, and other rules defined in the system.

Identify and list all factors that should be considered for incident assignment:
  • Determine if all incidents should be routed through the service desk.
  • Decide whether incidents should be assigned based on incident contact type. For example, should all incidents from self-service and incoming email be routed to service desk? Should incidents created based on alerts from an event monitoring system be routed to a support group?
  • Is there a need for location-based routing?
  • Can the routing be based on CI information?

If the service desk or first-level support group is unable to resolve an incident, they reassign the incident to another support group. This is referred to as functional escalation. Before reassigning an incident, all relevant information, for example, troubleshooting steps and referred knowledge articles, is documented. This enables the second/third level support team to be aware of all steps taken to troubleshoot and resolve the issue. An incident should be assigned to a group member before starting the diagnosis process.

Update the following fields to ensure that the relevant information is documented and that this information is available to the support groups as incidents are assigned to them. 

 Field Description
 State The state of the incident should be In progress if it is actively being worked on. The incident should be assigned to a user, who is responsible for the process of investigation  and diagnosis.
 Assignment group                        The assignment group on the incident form should be filtered to show only the itil type. This is to ensure that incidents are not assigned to other types of groups, for example, approval or development.

 

As the incident is being diagnosed, it may be reassigned several times to different groups. When reassigning an incident, it is important to document the reason for the reassignment, and to provide all the required information to assist with incident resolution/recovery.

Complete the following steps to configure the incident form based on proven practice recommendations:

  1. Add a UI policy to set the field Assigned to as mandatory if the state is not New.
  2. Create a client script to set the field Work notes as mandatory on assignment group updates, except on first entry.
  3. To create assignment rules, navigate to System Policy > Rules > Assignment.
